meanings.definition: To segregate again, especially by race.
meanings.sent1: The school district was resegregating students based on their ethnicity.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood was slowly resegregating as families of different races moved in.
meanings.sent3: The ants were resegregating into separate groups based on the color of their exoskeletons.
meanings.sent4: The city's policies were resegregating the community, creating divisions based on skin color.
meanings.sent5: The resegregating process was causing tension and unrest among the residents.

meanings.definition: The act of separating or isolating a group based on certain characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The resegregating of students in the cafeteria led to visible divisions among classmates.
meanings.sent2: The resegregating of employees based on their performance levels caused discontent in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The resegregating of books on the library shelves by genre made it easier for readers to find what they wanted.
meanings.sent4: The resegregating of animals into different habitats at the zoo was done for their safety and well-being.
meanings.sent5: The resegregating of plants in the garden according to their sunlight needs improved their growth and health.
